chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
q: X -> bool
p: X -> bool
A: list X

Goal:
filter p (filter q A) = filter (fun x => p x && q x) A

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
filter : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> list A
filter_pq_eq : forall p q A, (forall x, x el A -> p x = q x) -> filter p A = filter q A
filter_pq_mono : forall p q A, (forall x, x el A -> p x -> q x) -> filter p A <<= filter q A
filter_fst : forall p x A, p x -> filter p (x :: A) = x :: filter p A
filter_fst' : forall p x A, ~ p x -> filter p (x :: A) = filter p A
filter_id : forall p A, (forall x, x el A -> p x) -> filter p A = A
in_filter_iff : forall x p A, x el filter p A < -> x el A /\ p x
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), x el filter f l < -> x el l /\ f x = true
filter_app : forall p A B, filter p (A ++ B) = filter p A ++ filter p B
filter_mono : forall p A B, A <<= B -> filter p A <<= filter p B
concat_filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list (list A)), concat (map (filter f) l) = filter f (concat l)
N.add_shuffle1 : forall n m p q : N, (n + m + (p + q))%N = (n + p + (m + q))%N
Z.add_shuffle1 : forall n m p q : Z, (n + m + (p + q))%Z = (n + p + (m + q))%Z
Nat.add_shuffle1 : forall n m p q : nat, n + m + (p + q) = n + p + (m + q)
filter_incl : forall p A, filter p A <<= A
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
N.div_unique : forall a b q r : N, (r < b)%N -> a = (b * q + r)%N -> q = (a / b)%N

Z.div_unique : forall a b q r : Z, (0 <= r < b)%Z \/ (b < r <= 0)%Z -> a = (b * q + r)%Z -> q = (a / b)%Z
List.filter_app : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l' : list A), filter f (l ++ l') = filter f l ++ filter f l'
ssrbool.and4P = fun b1 b2 b3 b4 : bool => if b1 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and4 b b2 b3 b4) (b && (b2 && (b3 && b4)))) then if b2 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and4 true b b3 b4) (true && (b && (b3 && b4)))) then if b3 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and4 true true b b4) (true && (true && (b && b4)))) then if b4 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and4 true true true b) (true && (true && (true && b)))) then ReflectT (ssrbool.and4 true true true true) (ssrbool.And4 ssrbool.is_true_true ssrbool.is_true_true ssrbool.is_true_true ssrbool.is_true_true) else ReflectF (ssrbool.and4 true true true false) (fun __top_assumption_ : ssrbool...
ssrbool.and5P = fun b1 b2 b3 b4 b5 : bool => if b1 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and5 b b2 b3 b4 b5) (b && (b2 && (b3 && (b4 && b5))))) then if b2 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and5 true b b3 b4 b5) (true && (b && (b3 && (b4 && b5))))) then if b3 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and5 true true b b4 b5) (true && (true && (b && (b4 && b5))))) then if b4 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and5 true true true b b5) (true && (true && (true && (b && b5))))) then if b5 as b return (reflect (ssrbool.and5 true true true true b) (true && (true && (true && (true && b))))) then ReflectT (...
filter_ext : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, filter f l = filter g l
filter_ext_in : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), (forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a) -> filter f l = filter g l
ext_in_filter : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l -> forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
filter_ext_in_iff : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> (forall a : A, a el l -> f a = g a)
ZMicromega.mk_eq_pos = fun x y t : positive => RingMicromega.Build_Formula (EnvRing.PEX x) RingMicromega.OpEq (EnvRing.PEsub (EnvRing.PEX y) (EnvRing.PEX t)) : positive -> positive -> positive -> RingMicromega.Formula Z Arguments ZMicromega.mk_eq_pos (_ _ _)%positive_scope
ssrbool.predI = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : ssrbool.pred T) => ssrbool.SimplPred ((fun (p3 p4 : ssrbool.pred T) (x : T) => p3 x && p4 x) p1 p2) : forall T : Type, ssrbool.pred T -> ssrbool.pred T -> ssrbool.simpl_pred T Arguments ssrbool.predI {T}%type_scope
